intro: Lycianthes michaelneei, commonly known as the Michaelneei nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant typically grows as an annual shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in inflorescences, while the fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in warm climates.
